p: The stem of A. monosperma is featured by its wavy shape and its cortex which is differentiated into collenchyma and chlorenchyma. The main function of collenchyma cells is to strengthen the organ, while the chlorenchyma aids in the photosynthesis process. The epidermal wall of both plant stems is featured by a thick wall, which can reduce water loss and contribute to the plant bearing high temperatures [ 35]. The stem of A. monosperma was characterized by the presence of cap-like sclerenchymatous fibers at the vascular bundle side, which provide hardness to the stem and hence are difficult to chew with the wind. These results agreed with [ 13, 35, 36].
